brand_info.name: Umbro
brand_info.positioning: The authentic football tailor of distinction, bridging the gap between professional performance and terrace culture.
brand_info.vision: To be the most authentic football brand in the world, deeply rooted in the culture of the game.
brand_info.mission: To outfit footballers and fans with high-quality, authentic gear that celebrates the passion and unity of the beautiful game.
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in 1924 in Wilmslow, England, by brothers Harold and Wallace Humphreys. The name is a portmanteau of 'Humphrey Brothers'. Starting from a small cupboard in a family pub, it grew to become the 'Dior of the football world', outfitting legendary teams and World Cup winners.

brand_values.brand_promise: Providing the quality and craftsmanship of a tailor with the performance required for the pitch.
differentiators: Focus on grassroots and fan culture over corporate flashiness
non_negotiables: The Double Diamond logo must be present
Connection to football or rugby culture

demographics.gender: Unisex (Primary focus on Men, growing Women's segment)

psychographics.behavior: Plays grassroots football, follows professional leagues, adopts heritage sportswear for daily fashion.

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Direct and relatable, avoiding the 'brash and noisy' tone of larger competitors.
tone_dos: Stay grounded in the game's reality

logo.primary_logo: Stacked Double Diamond with Umbro wordmark
logo.usage_rules: Must be used in black or white where possible; red accents allowed in specific 2024+ iterations.
logo.lockup_behavior: Stacked (Diamond above wordmark) is the standard for marketing and digital.
logo.safe_area: Minimum clear space equal to the height of the 'U' in the wordmark.

color_system.color_usage_rules: Black and white dominate for stability; vibrant colors are used to reflect kit and fan culture.

layout_principles.grid_system: Structured but flexible to allow for dynamic sports imagery
layout_principles.white_space_ratio: Moderate (Balanced to maintain a 'clean' but 'full' feel)
layout_principles.cta_placement: Bottom right for digital; integrated into layout for print

style.camera_feel: Film-like, documentary style, avoiding overly polished studio looks.
style.pose_guidelines: Natural, relaxed, or action-oriented; models should look like real players or fans.
style.casting_attitude: Unpretentious, diverse, and genuinely connected to the game.

technical.lighting: Natural light, overcast 'British' feel, or high-contrast stadium lighting.
technical.contrast: Medium to High (to emphasize texture and grit)
technical.grain: Visible film grain often used for heritage/lifestyle collections.
technical.depth_of_field: Shallow for portraits; deep for stadium/crowd shots.
technical.color_grading: Desaturated or vintage-toned for heritage; vibrant and true-to-life for performance.

model_casting.diversity: High (Reflecting the global nature of football)

product_presentation.styling_approach: Mix of performance gear with casual lifestyle pieces (e.g., jerseys with denim).

motion_rules.pacing: Rhythmic, matching the energy of a match or urban life.
motion_rules.transitions: Clean cuts or film-burn effects for heritage content.

visual_dos: Include a football reference in every shot
Use the Double Diamond as a 'club crest'
visual_donts: Don't use overly bright, neon-only palettes
copy_dos: Reference specific football culture (e.g., Sunday League, VAR)
copy_donts: Don't sound like a tech company
Don't use 'win at all costs' aggressive language

retail.soundscape: Ambient stadium noise, Britpop, or local indie music.

digital.tone_adjustment: More interactive and reactive to live match events.

platform_behavior.Website: Clean, product-focused, easy navigation with heritage storytelling.
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Direct, community-focused, early access to drops.

print.paper: Uncoated, tactile paper for heritage lookbooks; high-gloss for performance catalogs.
print.cover_rules: Minimalist with a large Double Diamond or a high-impact portrait.

logo_misuse_examples: Using the 1924 script font for modern performance products
Placing the logo in a busy box that obscures the diamond shape
